definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: A major highlight of the ceremony is a unique paper-cut fashion show.
sentences.chinese: 頒獎典禮上一大亮點就是獨特的剪紙時裝秀。

sentences.english: The summit of Western Banquet activities will be the biggest bright spot.
sentences.chinese: 本次峯會的西餐夜宴將是活動的最大亮點。

sentences.english: Bruni also dives deep to offer some surprises on non-elite public schools.
sentences.chinese: 布魯尼還深入挖掘了一些非名校的公立大學的亮點。

sentences.english: In addition, a major highlight of the ceremony is a unique paper-cut fashion show.
sentences.chinese: 另外，在頒獎典禮上一大亮點就是獨特的剪紙時裝秀。

sentences.english: The generation of classroom teaching is a light-spot in implementing new courses.
sentences.chinese: 課堂教學的“生成”，是實施新課程的一大亮點。

sentences.english: Tourism may become a new bright spot in our bilateral cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 旅遊可以成爲雙邊合作的新亮點。

sentences.english: Mengcun construction fastener has become a new bright spot in economic development.
sentences.chinese: 在建築扣件已成爲孟村經濟發展中的新亮點。

sentences.english: The picturesque city of Fez is anther aspects of Morocco.
sentences.chinese: 非斯這個獨特的城市也是摩洛哥的一個亮點。

sentences.english: P. Morgan's big win came in fixed-income markets.
sentences.chinese: 摩根大通當季業績最大亮點來自於固定收益市場。

sentences.english: The local autonomy of Shanghai was a highlight of local political practice in the late Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 上海地方自治是清末地方政治實踐的一個亮點。

sentences.english: Yellow stripes on head and light spot on each marginal scute .
sentences.chinese: 頭部兩邊有黃色條紋且頭頂有亮點。

sentences.english: Developing the forest tourism industry energetically has become the new bright spot of the landscape planning.
sentences.chinese: 大力發展森林旅遊業，成爲景觀規劃的新亮點。

sentences.english: Africa will be the highlight of an otherwise dismal year.
sentences.chinese: 非洲將是這異常淒涼的一年裏的亮點。

sentences.english: What were your highlights of the 2010 Betfred. com World Snooker Championship?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得2010年世界斯諾克錦標賽的亮點是什麼？

sentences.english: Marin Cilic vs. Marcos Baghdatis would be a highlight of the third round.
sentences.chinese: 第三輪，西里奇與巴格達蒂斯是一亮點。

sentences.english: Ma Xiaohui's solo beautifully represents Chinese culture in Norway's Pavilion.
sentences.chinese: 馬曉輝的獨奏成爲挪威館裏中國元素的突出亮點。

definition: important point/main point/focus/key (project etc)/to focus on/to put the emphasis on
to recount (e.g. results of election)/to re-evaluate
one's conduct/deed/activity/accomplishment/achievement/to act as/as (in the capacity of)/qua/to view as/to look upon (sth as)/to take sth to be
to revolve around/to center on (an issue)
not only (this one)/not just (...) but also
opera (or role) involving much singing and action/(fig.) highlight/main feature/major activity
